item.title: When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable
item.description:
When Corporations Kill - Progressive Roundtable

Alex Lawson, Social Security Works & Sarah Badawi, Progressive Change Campaign Committee (PCCC) join Thom. Plus Special Panel Guest - Patty Lovera, Food & Water Watch. The Department of Justice is launching an investigation into the Dole Food company - one of the world's largest processors of fresh produce.

item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.title: A Turning Point for China?
item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Congo Opposition Leader Faces Mercenary Charges, Backers Cry Foul
item.description:
Congo Opposition Leader Faces Mercenary Charges, Backers Cry Foul

A leading opposition candidate for president of Democratic Republic of Congo was questioned on Monday over government allegations of hiring mercenaries, a case that could halt his fledgling campaign in its tracks. Moise Katumbi arrived at the prosecutor general's office in the second city Lubumbashi, dressed in a white suit and surrounded by supporters who chanted "President!

item.title: Philippines Votes After Controversial Presidential Race
item.description:
Philippines Votes After Controversial Presidential Race

Millions of voters headed to the polls to elect a new president in the Philippines, with a belligerent, tough-talking mayor taking an early lead, according to unofficial tallies.

item.title: BBC Reporter Detained, Expelled from North Korea
item.description:
BBC Reporter Detained, Expelled from North Korea

A British reporter was ordered to leave North Korea by state authorities Monday after he was recently detained for allegedly "insulting the dignity" of the country in the run-up to its ruling party congress, the BBC said Monday.

item.title: France Outlines New Plan to Fight Extremism
item.description:
France Outlines New Plan to Fight Extremism

France's leftist government says it will create deradicalization centers around the country, sinking $45 million into a barrage of new proposals to fight terrorism. "Radicalization, recruitment strikes everywhere," French Prime Minister Manuel Valls said as he unveiled the proposals during a ministerial conference, warning the country will likely face another strike.
